About this item

  • BUY DIRECTLY FROM WOODLAND BULBS
  • INCLUDING PICTURE CARD LABEL
  • Single Snowdrops are the best-known and most widespread of the 20 species in its genus....They are among the first bulbs to bloom in winter-spring, guaranteed to form impressive carpets of white in areas where they are native or have been naturalised....This incredibly aesthetically-pleasing flower is a well-deserved recipient of the RHS Award of Garden Merit.
  • Flowers: January - March | Height: 4-6" | Position: Partially shaded or full sun Planting: 2-3" deep and 3-6" apart | Soil: Well drained, moist, moderately fertile.

Product description

Item Package Quantity:25

Single Snowdrops Top Quality Freshly-Lifted, Galanthus Nivalis, is the best-known and most widespread of the 20 species in its genus, Single Snowdrops are among the first bulbs to bloom in winter-spring, they will form impressive carpets of white in areas where they are native or have been naturalised. This fabulous pretty flower is a well deserved recipient of the RHS Award of Garden Merit

How are ratings calculated?
To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyses reviews to verify trustworthiness.

Holly
5.0 out of 5 stars ... so I was a bit worried they would be bad. They came packaged in a box with plastic ...
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 March 2018
Item Package Quantity: 100Verified Purchase
Never ordered bulbs off Amazon before so I was a bit worried they would be bad.

They came packaged in a box with plastic bag and packing nuts to keep the bulbs safe and moisture on the bulbs.

The soil was shaken off quite well so there wasnt too much mess when splitting them up

The quality of the bulbs is excellent, they are fat and shiny and hard and show no stress of being put in a box and shipped!

I contacted the company about the bulbs as it was frozen outside so couldnt be planted, they got back to me the same day on how to plant them in pots until I could get them in the ground.

Very happy and will order more from this company

Edit to next year and it's Feb beginning and was scared as nothing yet but this morning I went out and LOOK :-Dddd
Year after year they will only get bigger
I have loads of small bunches popping up under all my plants

Alan Shakespeare
5.0 out of 5 stars Snowdrops
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 October 2020
Item Package Quantity: 100Verified Purchase
The best way that i know is drop them in the water and leave them over night and don't cut them, find a nice area of peat area of your garden if you got clay buy a 20kg bag will do. Don't separate them in one go make a shape of square and plant them as they are. You may not get many the first year but there will start to grow the follow year and will spread out during the years if you see any blubs keep them a dry space until the following year September time

Verified Purchase
Last year in my review I gave Woodland Bulbs and these Snowdrops five stars and said they had arrived as healthy looking plants in full flower so gave a nice healthy display immediately.
